com.strictparser.csv

Class CSVParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.strictparser.csv.CSVParser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.lang.Iterable<CSVRecord>

    public class CSVParser
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable, java.lang.Iterable<CSVRecord>
     Used to Read the CSV files by following the standard CSV rules.
    Example: 
     
 CSVParser parser = new CSVParser(new FileReader(new File(filePath)), CSVConstants.DELIM_COMMA, CSVConstants.SEPARATOR_DOUBLE_QUOTE);
 
 List<CSVRecord> records = parser.getRecords();
 
 for (CSVRecord record : records) {
        // Do something
 }
    Version:
    1.0 Sep 1, 2015.
    Author:
    Uma Sankar [umasankar.yedida@gmail.com]

      • CSVParser

        public CSVParser(java.io.Reader reader,
         char delimiter,
         char separator)
          throws java.io.IOException
         
 CSVParser constructor requires below parameters.
        Parameters:
        reader - Contains the file object
        delimiter - the character which used to seperate the columns.
        separator - the character which used to enclose the column data
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if reader object is null or file not found

      • CSVParser

        public CSVParser(java.io.Reader reader,
         char delimiter,
         char separator,
         boolean continueParseOnExceptionOccured)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Overloaded constructor
        Parameters:
        reader - Contains the file object
        delimiter - the character which used to seperate the columns.
        separator - the character which used to enclose the column data
        continueParseOnExceptionOccured - 
                                true - continues the parsing process even invalid records found
                        false - breaks the parsing process if any exception occurs
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • CSVParser

        public CSVParser(java.io.Reader reader,
         char delimiter,
         char separator,
         boolean continueParseOnExceptionOccured,
         boolean isHeaderIncluded)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Overloaded constructor
        Parameters:
        reader - Contains the file object
        delimiter - the character which used to seperate the columns.
        separator - the character which used to enclose the column data
        continueParseOnExceptionOccured - true - continues the parsing process even invalid records found false - breaks the parsing process if any exception occurs
        isHeaderIncluded - true - header will be included in the response false - header will be excluded in the response
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
         Validate the CSV File and returns true, if it is valid and false, otherwise.
        Returns:
        true - if file is in valid format false - if file is in wrong format

      • getRecords

        public java.util.List<CSVRecord> getRecords()
                                     throws CSVFormatException,
                                            java.io.IOException
         Returns the list of CSVRecord objects if the file is in proper CSV Format
 throws CSVFormatException if it is invalid.
        Returns:
        list of CSVRecords
        Throws:
        CSVFormatException - if provided CSV file contains wrong format.
        java.io.IOException - on parse error or input-read failed.
